com.versant.fund
Interface Attr

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
All Known Subinterfaces:
AttrBoolean, AttrBooleanArray, AttrBooleanList, AttrByte, AttrByteArray, AttrByteList, AttrDouble, AttrDoubleArray, AttrDoubleList, AttrFloat, AttrFloatArray, AttrFloatList, AttrHandle, AttrHandleArray, AttrHandleList, AttrInt, AttrIntArray, AttrIntList, AttrList, AttrLong, AttrLongArray, AttrLongList, AttrShort, AttrShortArray, AttrShortList, AttrString, AttrString8Bit, AttrStringList, AttrTraversable
public interface Attr
extends java.lang.Cloneable

The interface from which all Attr helper interfaces derive.

Access to attributes in a persistent object is managed using an Attr helper instance.

Interfaces prefixed with "Attr" such as AttrInt, AttrFloat are Attr helper instances. Classes that implement the Attr interface can be used to:

  • Specify what attributes a class will have when creating a database class.
  • Specify which attribute to access when reading or writing the attribute value of an instance.
  • Specify the attributes to query on when querying a class in the database.
Each Attr object is strongly typed to map with a corresponding VERSANT database attribute type.

Method Summary
 java.lang.String getAscii(Handle h)
          Returns a representation of the attribute as an US-ASCII string (Unicode character 32 to 126).
 java.lang.Object getObject(Handle h)
          Returns the value represented by this attribute using standard Java classes such as Boolean, Integer, Float, Double, String and array classes.
 java.lang.String name()
          Returns the name of the attribute.
 void putAscii(Handle h, java.lang.String s)
          Puts the value of this attribute from a string, which is the same format as returned by getAscii().
 void putObject(Handle h, java.lang.Object obj)
          Puts the value of this attribute from obj, as returned by getObject().
 void setInfo(java.lang.String s)
          Sets the VERSANT auxinfo field for this attribute.
 

Method Detail

setInfo

void setInfo(java.lang.String s)
Sets the VERSANT auxinfo field for this attribute.

This attribute type information is not VERSANT specific. The semantics for specifying this information are well described by the JVM specification. It is more popularly known as "Type Descriptor" information.The semantics differ for primitive types,class types, array types etc.

Example

Attribute type Type Descriptor
int I
boolean [] [Z
String Ljava/lang/string;

Classes defined from the JVI Transparent binding internally use this method to store attribute domain information that is used during schema evolution checking. If you set this value for an attribute of a transparent Java object, the schema checking in the JVI transparent binding will be affected.

Parameters:
s - The string to be stored in the auxinfo
